body:
{"description":"About the job
Position: Full Stack Developer


About the role:

As an integral part of the Information Technology team, the Full Stack Developer will work under the direction of the Vice President of Information Technology to plan, develop, and implement internal web-based applications for the Company’s proprietary ERP system. The Full Stack Developer, as part of a development team, will be responsible for the creation of new modules, reports, and general maintenance of the Company’s web-based ERP system to assist in data tracking and efficiency throughout the Company.


Do you have what it takes?

We pride ourselves in being flexible, but there are some things we feel very strongly about. We are careful to select people for our team that have demonstrated excellence through their skills, character, and background. It takes talent and drive to meet the challenges of our rapidly evolving environment – and that’s all the fun! Are you looking for new ways to raise the bar and don’t blink at challenges? Do you want a fulfilling career that takes advantage of your talents? If so, then it’s time to join DecoArt. Now is the time to be a part of something big!


What you will be doing:

Develop and maintain web-based business applications for the Company’s ERP system in a PHP/MySQL/Linux/Apache environment.
Make use of complicated SQL queries and database structure to effectively manage reporting interfaces, data speed and optimization, and data analyzation.
Assist in custom development for eCommerce D2C and B2B sites.
Use industry standards to write well designed, efficient, and testable code.
Document all aspects of assigned development tasks, including front-end, back-end, and database development.
Assist in debugging, staging, testing, and deployment of websites and applications.
Effectively perform complete testing of web applications and report results. 
Expand knowledge of new technologies as needed for new project requirements. Self-educate on industry standards and emerging technologies regularly.
Create and execute project work plans to ensure accountability.
Comply with departmental coding standards.
Manage time and commitments within project schedule.
Utilize department ticketing software to track tasks and projects.


What you need: 

4-year degree in Information Systems or equivalent experience
High level knowledge of PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Linux, AJAX, and JQuery
2 years’ experience in web development with a heavy focus on back-end functionality consisting of: Object oriented development, Design patterns, and Complex SQL queries
Experience in the design and implementation of technical solutions
Functional knowledge of Excel and other Office products
History working with ERP systems, whether proprietary or big box (preferred)
Predictive and generative AI experience (preferred)
Experience with eCommerce platforms and plugins, specifically BigCommerce (preferred)
Functional knowledge of accounting including accounts payable, receivables and general ledger (preferred)
History working with a manufacturing / distribution environment (preferred)
Atlassian Jira / Confluence for ticketing and documentation (preferred)
PHPStorm / Navicat for development and database manipulation (preferred)
Demonstrated problem solving skills and the ability to implement solutions quickly
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively
Extremely organized, flexible, and able to work in a fast-paced environment with tight production timelines
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work closely with other departments and production entities
Capable of multi-tasking and working on several projects at one time
Must work well under pressure with the ability to meet tight deadlines
Must be thorough with a strong sense of attention to detail and the ability to follow through
Ability to work with a group of highly motivated individuals, as well as be individually proactive
Desire to learn, seek new challenges and to take on additional responsibilities
Friendly, engaging, and professional demeanor
Demonstrated strong time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate
Ability to maintain and hold confidential information
Demonstrated ability to understand and follow written and verbal communication
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including strong presentation skills to varied audiences, and stakeholder groups
Ability to lead and resolve problems on a professional level
Must be resourceful and initiative-taking
Self-motivated, driven individual with collaborative communication style
Must be willing to travel as needed and work at all DecoArt locations as needed
The determination to work harder than anyone you know 
Ability to occasionally lift up to 40 lbs.
Ability to see product colors and differentiate between shades


What we offer:

Competitive base salary
Comprehensive benefit package including quality health insurance, vision, dental, disability and life insurance
Traditional 401k plan and company match
Paid time off including paid holidays
 A chance to learn with and from interesting and enthusiastic colleagues
Collaborative workplace, which will challenge you and celebrate your work


Where you'll be: 220 Lexington Green, Suite 400, Lexington, KY 40503
The candidate will be required to work onsite. This is not a remote or hybrid position.
 
What we’d like from you:

A resume that illustrates why you are the right person for this role.
This position does not meet the legal criteria for an independent contractor to perform the duties of the role.


Come and Be Inspired!

For 35 years DecoArt has inspired creativity. In our consumers we inspire the creativity to craft, decorate, and make. In our employees we inspire the creativity to innovate, problem solve, and get things done.


DecoArt is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. We welcome all qualified job seekers regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, genetic information, disability, or protected veteran status.



If you have a disability and believe you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for this position, email HR@decoart.com with your request. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or correspondence. We will only respond to those requests that are related to the accessibility of the online application system due to a disability."}
